channel.title: Upload patches problems
channel.description: Hi there, I have a simple question. Which is the right way (step by step) to save/upload a patch to the axoloti (sd) in order to play it standalone? Thank you for now!

Thank you @jaffasplaffa !

item.title: Upload patches problems
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

@lotwenzel

If you just want to upload a single patch to axoloti you can do that by:
1. Open the patch.
2. Go do drop down menu "patch".
3. Select "upload ot sd-card as startup".
4. You now have a single stand alone Axoloti instrument

If you want to upload more patches, you could try the "patch bank" system, which you can find info about by searching. Or start from this thread:

Patch Changes and File structure in sd card

I have added an object "patch/bankindex" to obtain the index of the last loaded patch via "patch/load i" and a few ready-made "controller objects", for version 1.0.10, you get them via "sync libraries". "controller/select patch with potentiometer": connect a potentiometer to PA7 to select 16 patches "controller/cycle buttons" : use switches S1/S2 to go to the next/previous patch in the patch bank "controller/pgmchange" : use midi program change to load a patch and a simple patch bank for teâ€¦

I cant help you with the specifics on using a patch bank, since I havent used that myself.
But the single patch is really simple to do.

Read full topic
